name: Fresh Tomato Pasta
author: Marco Rossi
description: A light and fresh pasta dish featuring ripe tomatoes, garlic, and basil. Ready in just 20 minutes for a perfect weeknight dinner.
recipeIngredient: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
recipeInstructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook according to package directions until al dente.
While pasta is cooking, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and red pepper flakes (if using) and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add diced tomatoes to the skillet and cook for 5-7 minutes until they start to break down and release their juices.
Season the tomato mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
Drain the pasta, reserving 1/2 cup of pasta water.
Add the pasta to the skillet with the tomato mixture and toss to combine. If the pasta seems dry, add a splash of the reserved pasta water.
Remove from heat and stir in the torn basil leaves.
Serve immediately, topped with grated Parmesan cheese.
